devdoc.details: Shows how to work with dynamic byte arrays and fixed-size byte arrays in Solidity

appendToBytes(bytes1).details: Correct implementation to append to a bytes array

params.newByte: The byte to append to b1

clearBytes().details: Clears the bytes array (sets it to empty)

clearDynamicArray().details: Clears the dynamic array of bytes arrays

getDynamicArrayLength().details: Gets the length of the dynamic array of bytes arrays

returns._0: The number of bytes arrays stored in arr1

getElement(uint256).details: Gets an element from the bytes array at a specific index

params.index: The position of the byte to retrieve (0-based)

returns._0: The byte at the specified index

getFromDynamicArray(uint256).details: Gets an element from the dynamic array of bytes arrays

params.index: The position in arr1 to access

returns._0: The bytes array at the specified index

getLength().details: Gets the length of the bytes array

returns._0: The number of bytes in b1

pushToDynamicArray(bytes).details: Adds a new bytes array to the dynamic array of bytes arrays

params.newBytes: The bytes array to add to arr1

toString().details: Converts the bytes array to a string

devdoc.title: Dynamic Byte Array Demonstration

appendToBytes(bytes1).notice: Creates a new bytes array that combines the existing b1 with the new byte

arr1(uint256).notice: This is an array where each element is itself a dynamic bytes arrayCan store any number of bytes arrays, each of variable lengthExample use case: storing multiple variable-length byte sequences

b1().notice: bytes is a dynamic byte array (similar to byte[] in other languages)Unlike bytes1-bytes32, its size can vary and individual bytes can be modifiedInitialized with 'abc' which becomes [0x61, 0x62, 0x63] in hex

clearBytes().notice: Demonstrates how to reset a bytes array

clearDynamicArray().notice: Demonstrates how to reset a bytes[] array

getElement(uint256).notice: Demonstrates accessing individual bytes in a bytes arrayReverts if index is out of bounds (>= b1.length)

getFromDynamicArray(uint256).notice: Shows how to access elements in the bytes[] array

getLength().notice: Shows how to get the current length of a dynamic bytes array

pushToDynamicArray(bytes).notice: Demonstrates using the dynamic array (arr1) of bytes arrays

toString().notice: Shows how to interpret bytes as a stringOnly works correctly for UTF-8 encoded text bytes

userdoc.notice: Demonstrates the differences between bytes (dynamic) and bytesN (fixed-size) types
